svmodt 0.1.0
  • Reference

    • Constructing Oblique Trees with svmodt

    Predict with a Decision Tree

    predict_tree.Rd

    Predicts class labels or class probabilities for new data using a decision tree generated by generate_tree. Handles internal nodes, leaf nodes, and both numeric and factor splits. Supports batch predictions for data frames.

    predict_tree(node, input, return_probs = FALSE)

    Arguments

    node

    A decision tree object returned by generate_tree.

    input

    A named list representing a single observation or a data frame of observations.

    return_probs

    Logical; if TRUE, returns class probabilities instead of predicted labels.

    Value

    If return_probs = FALSE, returns a character vector of predicted class labels. If return_probs = TRUE, returns a numeric matrix or named vector of class probabilities.

    Details

    - Supports numeric and factor features in internal nodes. - For numeric features, splits are <= for left and > for right. - For factor features, matches the split level for left; all other levels go right. - Batch predictions for data frames are automatically handled row-wise. - If a required feature is missing in the input, a warning is issued and NA is returned. - Probabilities are returned as a named vector for a single observation or a matrix for multiple rows.

    Examples

    data(wdbc)
features <- wdbc[, 2:31]
target <- wdbc$diagnosis
tree <- generate_tree(target, features, max_depth = 3)

# Predict single observation
predict_tree(tree, as.list(features[1, ]))
#> [1] "B"

# Predict multiple observations
predict_tree(tree, features[1:5, ], return_probs = TRUE)
#>               B         M
#> [1,] 0.52941176 0.4705882
#> [2,] 0.01156069 0.9884393
#> [3,] 0.01156069 0.9884393
#> [4,] 0.39130435 0.6086957
#> [5,] 0.52941176 0.4705882
